page.title: 10THE VILLAGE OF NOKE
page.content: The lower part of the village of Noke lies just within the block to the North. It is very isolated, being situated at the end of a "no through road" which leads off the B42O7. At the beginning of this road,which leads steeply downhill, there are beautiful views over the valley of Otmoor. The houses in this lower part of the village vary. Some are modern post-war houses, built to blend in with the rest of the village. At the extreme end of the village there is a beautiful old manor house. There is a bridleway from this end of the village leading behind Prattle Wood back to the B4O27. Unlike Woodeaton and Elsfield, Noke has a public house. This is very popular because as well as all kinds of alcoholic drinks they serve nice meals. The inn is not in the block.
